intro: Hippocrepis bicontorta, commonly known as the two-lobed scabious, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features slender, erect stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically blue or purple, with five petals and a distinctive two-lobed structure at the base. Hippocrepis bicontorta thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands, woodland edges, and rocky areas.
